result.execSummary:
The defendant Frankie Feliciano Colon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight time if imposed.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Comply with random urine screens. Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia .  No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Any valid prescriptions drugs must be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. Inform Agent of all prescriptions.

Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  No contact with Sears. DNA Sample/Surcharge waived. No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed.
 If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber, non working hours.  7 days credit applied.  Commencing FORTHWITH.
To be performed as a condition of probation.

filed, to be produced from Washington County Jail.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frankie Feliciano Colon in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Emil Kershek.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant appears by video.  The Court sets the matter for plea and sentencing and the Defendant is to be produced for the hearing.  The Clerk's office to prepare and OTP and the defendant is to arrive at the Waukesha County Jail by Thursday, May 5.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.
To Washington County, please have inmate available for video conference.
